alert.note: Alert for Big Stone; Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Traverse, northwestern Big Stone and southeastern Roberts Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, a trained weather spotter reported a thunderstorm producing a funnel cloud near Beardsley, or 9 miles southeast of Browns Valley, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Funnel Clouds SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Yankeetown, Lismore Colony, Bonanza Grove, Wilmot and Big Stone Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
